intro: Guatteria pakaraimae, commonly known as the Pakaraima guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the humid forests of the Guyana Shield, particularly in Venezuela and Guyana. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, fleshy berries. This species is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
